title: Signal-SGN: A Spiking Graph Convolutional Network for Skeletal Action Recognition via Learning Temporal-Frequency Dynamics
abstract: arXiv:2408.01701v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: In skeletal-based action recognition, Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) based methods face limitations due to their complexity and high energy consumption. Spiking Neural Networks (SNNs) have gained attention in recent years for their low energy consumption, but existing methods combining GCNs and SNNs fail to fully utilize the temporal characteristics of skeletal sequences, leading to increased storage and computational costs. To address this issue, we propose a Signal-SGN(Spiking Graph Convolutional Network), which leverages the temporal dimension of skeletal sequences as the spiking timestep and treats features as discrete stochastic signals. tldr: 该文章提出了一种名为Signal-SGN的突触图卷积网络，用于通过学习时频动态来识别骨骼动作，该网络通过采用时序特征作为突触触发步长处理骨骼序列，并将特征视为离散的随机信号。该网络的核心是一个1D突触图卷积网络（1D-SGN）和一个频率突触卷积网络（FSN），能够在保持较低能耗的同时，有效地处理骨骼动作的时间特征，提高了动作识别的效率和准确率。
